story:
SoleMate Sox- MatchMaker For Lost Socks

 

Born From Frustration+Love

Hey everyone! I'm Catenya McHenry, inventor of SoleMate Sox magnetic socks. How many of you have lost socks? Unless you live on a remote island in the South Pacific (take me there), you probably have a sack of singles just hoping their sock mate will come back. SoleMate Sox is the solution for lost socks.

This idea of SoleMate Sox was born from raw frustration! Nearly every morning, one of my three children, is running down the hall yelling they have no socks, let alone matching pairs, free of holes in the toes. I kept thinking there had to be something on the market that held socks together but I found nothing, online and in stores!! I know, I was just as shocked too because the sock industry is a billion dollar empire.

What started as a homemade solution at my kitchen table just to figure out if I could actually invent a fix, turned into hundreds of research hours, design+strategy meetings with engineers, magnet behavior experiments, visits to sock manufacturers, fabric research, several prototypes, sock samples, magnet testing sessions, and nearly 2 1/2 years of development. All of that has lead patent-pending amazing technology to keep your socks from being single forever.

The technology,  functionality+practicality is one thing, design+comfort is another. I had to make sure to create socks that were far from bleh+ boring- that people would actually be excited to slip on or break glass ceilings in.

Love in Design+Storytelling

I'm in love with nature's magnificence and I love stories and storytelling.Working with our design team, each of those passions+inspirations are infused into the sock's designs. As a television journalist, I wanted each design to express a deeper story that all ties back to love. I think it makes each pair more meaningful, purposeful and intentional.

 

Purpose, intent+love- each of those elements is evident in the socks. From the heart logo on the heel, to the super-soft Bamboo threads in each pair, and the vibrant, fun designs, SoleMate Sox is the stress-free sensible way to make your day! 

Better Quality

Our first production run was doable and we sold lots of socks but I wanted to amp up our quality. I went back to the drawing board, spending months studying, researching+ testing comfortable threads and fabrics to manufacture the best possible longer-lasting pairs. My goal was to explore more eco-friendly, materials. That's when I learned about the benefits of bamboo.

It turns out, bamboo is incredibly beneficial! It's not only eco-friendly and sustainable, growing super fast without pesticides and human intervention but its threads are stronger than cotton, softer, breathable, and moisture-wicking. Bamboo is naturally porous with anti-bacterial and anti-fungal properties, zapping foot funk+ contributing to healthier feet. Diabetic patients and sock lovers who suffer from skin disorders will be thrilled to wear our Sox. Each of our pairs are knitted with reinforced heel and toe. In addition, you'll be walking on a cushion bottom for ultimate cushion comfort.

Become A SoleMate

Now that SoleMate Sox has been on the market for a year, we’re ready to move the business into the next phase of development. We plan to expand our collaborations, launch our kids and sports collections, license the magnet technology to other sock companies, and continue partnering with artists around the globe to create exclusive designs. We also need to hire happy part-time staff to help us behind the scenes with our charitable causes (helping the homeless and breast cancer patients), social media, marketing, media outreach, and a buyer who can help us land SoleMate Sox in stores across the globe. We’ve run the numbers and it will take $10,000 to begin and sustain Phase 2.

The Impact

We see the phenomenal potential in SoleMate Sox because EVERYONE we know has lost socks into an unknown ether- which is why everyone across the globe needs our socks! Sock lovers are steadily catching on. Within the first week of launching our store in December 2015, we sold out of several designs and sizes. We busted out a Mariah Carey high note on that one!

SoleMate Sox is already having a significant impact on the market. It's caught the attention of the abc-tv affiliate in Birmingham, AL and we're ecstatic!

SoleMate Sox is not only practical but we've managed to remove the stress of searching single socks and infuse magic+ love into something that can be taken for granted. You shouldn't be frustrated by losing socks but instead excited and relieved that your socks will never be single again because SoleMate Sox does the matching for you. Now we need your help to keep spreading the love.
 

Risks & Challenges

We know the market is saturated with sock brands but SoleMate Sox is the only magnetic sock brand with fun, vivacious designs that stay together on laundry day. The only challenge left is fund-raising. I'm an optimist though, so I don't see gaining your support as challenging. I see it this as an incredible opportunity to be a part of something revolutionary and groundbreaking- born from frustration but bloomed with love.

Other Ways You Can Help: Share the Love

If you can't contribute, it's ok. We completely understand. We'd love your help in a different way though. Sharing the love is just as important to us as a financial contribution. Here's how:

  • Show SoleMate Sox some love by sharing with all your friends far and wide on your social media channels. It's amazing what can happen when kindred spirits join forces!
  • Indiegogo also has some smart sharing tools that you can use.

Bamboo is naturally porous with anti-bacterial and anti-fungal properties, zapping foot funk+ contributing to healthier feet. Diabetic patients and sock lovers who suffer from skin disorders will be thrilled to wear our Sox. Each of our pairs are knitted with reinforced heel and toe. In addition, you'll be walking on a cushion bottom for ultimate cushion comfort.


Become A SoleMate
Now that SoleMate Sox has been on the market for a year, we’re ready to move the business into the next phase of development. We plan to expand our collaborations, launch our kids and sports collections, license the magnet technology to other sock companies, and continue partnering with artists around the globe to create exclusive designs. We also need to hire happy part-time staff to help us behind the scenes with our charitable causes (helping the homeless and breast cancer patients), social media, marketing, media outreach, and a buyer who can help us land SoleMate Sox in stores across the globe. We’ve run the numbers and it will take $10,000 to begin and sustain Phase 2.

The Impact
We see the phenomenal potential in SoleMate Sox because EVERYONE we know has lost socks into an unknown ether- which is why everyone across the globe needs our socks! Sock lovers are steadily catching on. Within the first week of launching our store in December 2015, we sold out of several designs and sizes. We busted out a Mariah Carey high note on that one!
SoleMate Sox is already having a significant impact on the market. It's caught the attention of the abc-tv affiliate in Birmingham, AL and we're ecstatic!
SoleMate Sox is not only practical but we've managed to remove the stress of searching single socks and infuse magic+ love into something that can be taken for granted. You shouldn't be frustrated by losing socks but instead excited and relieved that your socks will never be single again because SoleMate Sox does the matching for you. Now we need your help to keep spreading the love.
 

Risks & Challenges
We know the market is saturated with sock brands but SoleMate Sox is the only magnetic sock brand with fun, vivacious designs that stay together on laundry day. The only challenge left is fund-raising. I'm an optimist though, so I don't see gaining your support as challenging. I see it this as an incredible opportunity to be a part of something revolutionary and groundbreaking- born from frustration but bloomed with love.

Other Ways You Can Help: Share the Love
If you can't contribute, it's ok. We completely understand. We'd love your help in a different way though. Sharing the love is just as important to us as a financial contribution. Here's how:

Show SoleMate Sox some love by sharing with all your friends far and wide on your social media channels. It's amazing what can happen when kindred spirits join forces!
Indiegogo also has some smart sharing tools that you can use.

story:
What We Need

To secure a funding of USD 20 000 to build a 5kW wind turbine as a test bed and case study for future implementation in underdeveloped countries & urbanized cities.

Problems

Climate change challenges vis-à-vis carbon emissions is an issue we constantly combat. Besides using huge fossil energy, it also brings along massive environment destruction which are irreversible.

We have 2 daily challenges: unfortunately many underdeveloped countries are still shortages of electricity & a missed opportunity to tap energy from unconventional sources. 

Without a well-built electrical system, these off grid areas are experiencing a lower quality of life as compare to others. Until year 2030, the percentage of people without electricity will be at an astounding 10%.  Our Speedy is akin to a standalone power barge to provide electricity for communities.

Statistics for people without electricity in 2009 and prediction for 2030.  (Source: http://makewealthhistory.org/2012/10/26/the-real-fuel-poverty-challenge/)

In addition, "By my very rough estimate, residential, commercial, and industrial air conditioning worldwide consumes at least one trillion kilowatt-hours of electricity annually." reported Stan Cox, Yale environment 360, Jul 12.  Speedy can recover this energy from these unconventional sources.

 As such, our products are dedicated to meet the needs by providing

1) Renewable clean energy that are environmentally friendly.

2) Off-grid village so as to enhance their quality of life.

3) Better utilization of existing electricity. 

Conceptualization

Speedy wind turbine started off as a joint collaboration between our Commercialization Team and FYP Roy Sng and Supervisor William Phay of SIM University. William who is also the founder of the initiatives sees that this technology has more potential to tackle climate change challenges.  Together as a team, we conceptualized our idea of utilizing this wind turbine for underdeveloped countries & urbanized cities.  To date, we have developed a wind farm of 20 Speedy in Singapore. It has been running for > 2 years.  As such, we intend to embark on this adventure to build and test-bed the efficiency of a larger 5kW turbine so that more energy can be produced. The success would mean that the turbine can be deployed in places that need it most.   

Speedy

How special is Speedy? How different is Speedy from the remaining turbines in the market? In this section we will reveal the interesting concept that leads to the birth of Speedy and its awesome benefits. Firstly, the product is real and the team is real.  Speedy is NOT a 3D toy but real stuff that save money for you. 

Secondly, Speedy is more effective.  It’s a misconception that wind will hit the turbine blades at a similar speed  & perpendicularly.

In reality, varying seasonal conditions & uneven ground/building conditions means that the wind needs to “navigate” through obstacles and rebounding off grounds before colliding with a turbine. As such, the interaction of the wind and a turbine blade is never uniform. Perhaps, more wind at the bottom than the top blade.

You have more control to catch the wind now! The team has developed a stackable, staggered 3 blades wind turbine.

Speedy is a stack-able, staggered blades wind turbines. During the summer you can adjust 2 long aligned blades down offset with a 1 blade top. During the winter, perhaps 1 blade down and 2 long aligned blades top. Compare to the convention one long continuous blade turbine which carries a heavy weight, each layer@Speedy can now spin at its optimum efficiency. In this case, we will be fully utilizing the wind energy.

 Better still, buy two sets and join them together for a 9 blades system.  You can play with different combinations to catch the best power.  You may even paste your favorite photos on the blades.

Compare to the convention one blade turbine which carries a heavy weight, each layer can now spin at its optimum efficiency. In this case, we will be fully utilizing the wind energy. 

Performance is backed by a tunnel test. A triple stacked Speedy can start to generate electricity at a mere 5 m/s wind and produce an extraordinary voltage of 65 volt at a wind speed of 15 m/s. 40% more efficient than a common 4 blades turbine in the market!!!  Add a gear-ratio-multiplier and Speedy can spin at low speed now. Try it out!!!

Thirdly, the triple stacked Speedy has won the 2015 Energy Innovation Challenge hosted by Institute of Engineer Singapore. Judges were totally impressed by our concept and efficiency output!

Lastly, our design team valued added Speedy with the concept of “FFS”- Feasibility, Flexibility & Sustainability. With these 3 points, Speedy can be easily catered to different sizes and configurations for a wide novel applications that are suited for every individual consumers at a cheap price with the least harm to the environment. 


The turbine has been featured in the following UniSIM and Today Newspaper. 


Purpose

One Dollar of Joy would like to bring a 5000 W Speedy to a offgrid community in Sihanoukville, Cambodia or Hanoi,Vietnam, etc. We call this a “one-$-wind”.  However, we need to be sure that it works efficiently first. Thus, through Indiegogo & yourself, we hope to raise enough money for the future implementation of 5000 W Speedy. 


Future & Beyond

Other than a turbine, we have plans for an imminent “Joybus” project to be launch soon.  It is an integrated mobile wastewater treatment system. Now that we have gained the support of the local authority, this project is the next to go.  Speedy provides the energy to run this wastewater treatment plant. If this campaign is successful, we will build the 5000 W turbine, embark on the Joybus campaign and solicit our backers as volunteers for the community project. We envision a stay at the village for a period of 3-5 days to conduct infrastructure & education works on environment protections, toilet trainings and basic hygiene.  Some of you may be interested in conducting English class too.  

Can u help us?  Let’s unite to fight climate change, provide for underdeveloped countries and to live wise in smart cities and also save money for you







Perks & Rewards

As our sponsor, you will have an early opportunity to own a Speedy turbine set!!! Our wind turbine perks comes in 50W, 100W & even 5000W. Every turbine set will comprise of a dual stacked Speedy, 1 meter mono-pole for erecting the turbine, 30 mins battery, a rectifier and a USB port to connect to your devices. 

Backers will receive a lighter and more efficient  Speedy turbine set and the accessories in a compacted box.  This will ease your shipping cost and installation process. (Please refer to "International Shipping for more information.)

Other than the Speedy turbine set, you will also receive perks as shown below:
 USB Powered Fan (5 assorted colours)


Volt-Ampmeter USB cable - (can attach a Samsung to iPhone connector)


LED light bulb (typical)


Medallion
The image shown is a 2-D image of our medals. The design will be engrave onto Gold, Silver and Bronze Medallion for our beloved ambassadors. 

                                              FRONT                                                       BACK

The Impact

To bring sustainable technology to off-grid villages & smart cities. Through the use of technology, we will like to enhance the quality of life for people in these underdeveloped regions & to "cool a warming planet". As such, we plead for your support in this campaign, help us chase our dream and be part of the family to realize it. 

Risks & Challenges

It is always a constant challenge to balance the cost and efficiency of a wind turbine. The team always wanted an affordable, sustainable and capable product for everyone. As such there is always a continuous effort in bringing the cost down. Over the months, we have searched through various manufacturing avenues and methods and finally we found the right recipe for a cost efficient turbine.

However, mass manufacturing of wind turbines may required some time if our project is successfully funded. Thus we have set the estimated delivery date to be 3 months from end of project to gain some time allowance. We will be also looking for alternative manufacturer if the production process is delayed. We believe with these two measures, the risk will be overcome. 

International Shipping

The team have always wanted to bring in affordable turbine to everyone. As much as we will like to include free shipping in our rewards, we face many constraints in doing this. As such, any shipping outside of Singapore will be payable by  backers.  Backers will need to arrange for your own package pick up and shipping service. However, we can also liaise with you on suitable shipping agency or courier service for your locations too. We seek your understanding in this matter.  Thank you, Ambassador Champions. Once all is done, you will receive our lovely turbine at your doorsteps in weeks!!! Information our our turbine are shown below to help you get a good quote on the shipping fees. 

For exporting out of Singapore, we suggest Speedpost to our supporters. Estimated shipping fee from Singapore to New York for 50 W and 100 W turbine is around USD 92 and USD 137 respectively.  
Speedpost is  http://www.speedpost.com.sg/. 
Two International Pick-up sites:
a) Singapore: Block 5066 Ang Mo Kio Industrial Park 2 #01-1411 Singapore 569569, Contact: Mr Loy Chiam.
b) Philippines: No 105 Yanga Street, Maysilo Malabon City, 1477 Metro Manila.  Contact: Mr Crisanto Cruz.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, we understand and still value your support. If you think our ideas are great

1.) Please share it with your family and friends

2.) Engage in Indiegogo share tools and spread our campaign

Any forms of help are greatly appreciated!!!

story:
Supporting Small Farmers

Lilian is a small-scale farmer in southwestern Uganda. She grows sweet potatoes, maize, beans, pumpkin, and sorghum on less than one acre of land. Lilian harvests wild foods, including passion fruit, spinach, and mushrooms. She is amongst 65 percent of Ugandans who rely on small-scale agriculture.

The cost of living in Uganda is increasing, but global food markets do not favour small-scale farmers like Lilian. "When we sell our product, food is cheap," she says. "When we have to buy, food is very expensive." There are other expenses, too, including: healthcare, medicine, school fees, household goods, clothes, etc. Food is often sold to afford education and healthcare.

Given the unjust pressures on small-scale farmers, it's no wonder many struggle to provide adequate nutrition to their families. The Ugandan Bureau of Statistics estimates 45 percent of children are malnourished. The World Health Organization says 31 percent of pregnant women are anemic. The most common form of malnutrition is kwashiorkor, protein energy malnutrition.


Permaculture at Home

This project seeks to give small-scale farmers in southwestern Uganda the basic means and culturally-relevant education to design and install their own Permaculture Gardens:

Permaculture means: perma / culture, or "permanent culture". It's a holistic design approach to living sustainably on the land. This is what Ugandan farmers have been doing for centuries, but due to colonialism and unjust markets, there's been a break-down in traditional knowledge practices. It's also difficult to afford materials to kick-start permaculture systems. We want to put knowledge and training back into the hands of small-scale farmers.

Our goals:

  • Improve food production & reduce child malnutrition
  • Generate income for household needs & school fees
  • Increase access to water & save women time
  • Help farmers become more efficient & productive

Water + Trees + Rabbits 

This project will provide 10 identified families in Kabale, Uganda with support to kick-start permaculture systems at home. This project will provide each family with the following:

  • 1. Rainwater catchment + underground water storage for 6000 litres
Families will be able to catch and store rainwater at home, saving women hours of labour and improving irrigation of their crops. The underground storage method uses local materials and can store enough water to last the 3-month dry season.

  • 2. Materials to construct raised vegetable beds + vegetable seeds
Each home will receive materials to build 2 large raised beds for intensive vegetable production, including carrots, swiss chard, spinach, kale, beets, and green peppers. The raised beds will produce year round with irrigation and help improve families' nutritional intake.


  • 3. Fruit tree seedlings: grafted avocado, guava, tree tomato and passion fruit
Families will plant grafted fruit trees in their gardens to yield fruits and vegetables, help prevent soil erosion, create shade in their systems, and keep water in the ground.

  • 4. Elevated rabbit cage + 3 rabbits (2 does + 1 buck)
Rabbits are an ideal meat-source to tackle child malnutrition. Rabbits reproduce every 2 months, produce large litters, and eat locally available materials: weeds and greens. Families will receive materials to build elevated cages and 3 rabbits to get started. In January 2016, our Rabbit Project was featured in Modern Farmer!

  • 5. Training in culturally relevant permaculture practice
  • 6. Ongoing support from farmer's groups and our field staff
One permaculture garden costs $500.00 x 10 farming families = $5000.00
Your donation will be matched dollar-for-dollar with a $2500 grant from the St. Albert Rotary Club in St. Albert, Canada. 
We aim to implement the project in August-September 2016.

The Story of Ceiba

Ceiba Association is a "for youth, by youth" registered non-profit organization in Edmonton, Canada. Our vision is "social justice through global citizenship." Over the past 12 years, we have supported grassroots organizations in Latin America and East Africa on projects promoting: education, food sovereignty, gender equity and indigenous rights. 

In May 2015, we funded a Holistic Child Nutrition Project in Kabale, Uganda, implementing a Permaculture School Garden with the students and staff at Kyanamira Primary School and building a Rabbit Breeding Centre with the Kigezi Healthcare Foundation (KIHEFO).

Our Field Team

Alphonse Twinamatsiko - Sustainable Agriculture Technician

Alphonse studied Rural Sustainable Development and Agriculture in Kenya. He grew up in the Kabale region of Uganda. For the past three years, he's been working closely NGOs in rural communities, including: Kairos, KIHEFO and Go Organic Africa. 

Atayo Benson - Sustainable Agriculture Technician

Atayo is originally from northern Uganda. He studied Mechanical Engineering at AICM in Kabale, Uganda. For the past two years, he's been working with Omusiri and KIHEFO, supporting the design and implementation of a permaculture school garden in Kyanamira. In January 2016, Atayo was named by the Alberta Council for Global Cooperation (ACGC) as one of their "Top 30 Under 30" global citizens.

Lilian Kamusiime - Social Worker
Over the past 15 years, Lilian has been a leader in her community in southwestern Uganda. Lilian is a primary teacher, social worker, and community tour guide. She is involved with a number of different community initiatives ranging from library projects to leadership initiatives for girls and young women. She is also regarded as one of the leading community tour guides in southwestern Uganda.

Trina Moyles - Permaculture Practitioner & Organizer

Trina is one of the founding members of Ceiba Association, and continues to play a role in the organization today. Since 2011, she's been involved with food security and permaculture projects in Cuba, Central America, and East Africa. Since 2013, she has lived in Kabale, Uganda, and continues to support local projects focusing on health, agriculture, and gender equity. She is also the author of Women Who Dig, a book about the experiences of female farmers and farmworkers, worldwide.

It Takes A Village...

We appreciate your support and donations! Thank you!
Interested to get involved with our campaign? Please share with your friends! Find us on Facebook and Twitter for all project news and updates. 

For more information:

Learn more about our approach to supporting rural communities achieve Food Sovereignty in East Africa and Latin America.
Any questions about our campaign? We'd love to hear from you:

Contact Us Today

In May 2015, we funded a Holistic Child Nutrition Project in Kabale, Uganda, implementing a Permaculture School Garden with the students and staff at Kyanamira Primary School and building a Rabbit Breeding Centre with the Kigezi Healthcare Foundation (KIHEFO).


Our Field Team
Alphonse Twinamatsiko - Sustainable Agriculture Technician
Alphonse studied Rural Sustainable Development and Agriculture in Kenya. He grew up in the Kabale region of Uganda. For the past three years, he's been working closely NGOs in rural communities, including: Kairos, KIHEFO and Go Organic Africa. 


Atayo Benson - Sustainable Agriculture Technician
Atayo is originally from northern Uganda. He studied Mechanical Engineering at AICM in Kabale, Uganda. For the past two years, he's been working with Omusiri and KIHEFO, supporting the design and implementation of a permaculture school garden in Kyanamira. In January 2016, Atayo was named by the Alberta Council for Global Cooperation (ACGC) as one of their "Top 30 Under 30" global citizens.


Lilian Kamusiime - Social Worker

Over the past 15 years, Lilian has been a leader in her community in southwestern Uganda. Lilian is a primary teacher, social worker, and community tour guide. She is involved with a number of different community initiatives ranging from library projects to leadership initiatives for girls and young women. She is also regarded as one of the leading community tour guides in southwestern Uganda.


Trina Moyles - Permaculture Practitioner & Organizer
Trina is one of the founding members of Ceiba Association, and continues to play a role in the organization today. Since 2011, she's been involved with food security and permaculture projects in Cuba, Central America, and East Africa. Since 2013, she has lived in Kabale, Uganda, and continues to support local projects focusing on health, agriculture, and gender equity. She is also the author of Women Who Dig, a book about the experiences of female farmers and farmworkers, worldwide.



It Takes A Village...We appreciate your support and donations! Thank you!Interested to get involved with our campaign? Please share with your friends! Find us on Facebook and Twitter for all project news and updates. For more information:Learn more about our approach to supporting rural communities achieve Food Sovereignty in East Africa and Latin America.Any questions about our campaign? We'd love to hear from you:Contact Us Today

story:
Like a Person in a Robot Suit!

The Nobot N1H1 is a humanoid device, remotely operated over IP, created to do your chores!

We combine the robot unit with a marketplace of operators so that every Nobot owner has a humanoid minion on tap, whenever they need one to do their bidding.  Think of it as R2D2 with speaking not beeping!

The core N1H1 unit is like someone dressed up as a robot, except they can be anywhere in the world and the Nobot is right beside you, or off doing an errand at your bidding.  Never tidy the house again!

Nobot is an product that will change the world for everyone, for the better:  Owners and Operators alike.


The Benefits for Nobot Owners

Our goal, with Nobot, is for every Nobot-owning individual, household or organisation to get more out of each day of their lives because of their Nobot.

Nobot N1H1 is our launch device, a general purpose humanoid.  

With this, and our subsequent, more specialist Nobots, the goal is that so many aspects of personal and business life and activity can be improved - if only because of the opportunity costs involved - by using Nobot.

At this point prior to launch we are busy building out partnerships and accessory packs (see below).  As things stand, even the base-level N1H1 unit is able to do a hundred and one things:

  • Act as a point of presence
  • Run errands
  • Be a companion
  • Undertake basic chores

As things develop, we will work with many organisations to enable their products for more seamless Nobot operation.  Whether this is the maker of construction equipment, or having coffee chains become 'Nobot-friendly' (for NFC-equipped variants) we know that Nobot will have a place in almost all areas of our lives.


Timeline

The Story Behind Nobot

When I was at school, we grew up with the (myth?) that NASA spent millions on a pen that could write in zero gravity, whereas the Russians issued their cosmonauts with pencils.
We have seen enough robot fail videos to know artificial intelligence (AI) isn't easy.
We also figured that there are perhaps a billion or more under-utilised minds in the world that could be much more powerful than any AI ever made.  Sure, they might not all become a chess grandmaster, but in terms of common-sense and the ability to learn quickly the human mind takes some beating.

Operators' Marketplace
The Nobot Operators' Marketplace allows a huge variety of people the world over to work in better conditions, for better pay than they could locally, but without having to emigrate.
This is hugely beneficial for the individuals concerned - they get the benefits of better work, based in the country that they love - but also massively positive for the countries concerned as there is not a 'brain drain'.
The Nobot Operators' Marketplace will be open to all, but also underpinned by a series of operator centres that we intend to set up around the world for Nobot operators who may otherwise not have the requisite hardware.
Our first Operator Centres will be in:
  • India
  • The Philippines
  • Eastern Europe

The Technology behind Nobot

Nobot uses some really great, but tried-and-tested technology.
The Nobot N1H1 device itself is relatively low-tech.  It is a mix of tried and tested hardware (camera, servos, Raspberry Pi, 3G dongle, etc) inside a study ABS plastic container.
We aspire to have a Nobot in every home and every business.  To do this, we couldn't make it cost a million dollars.  As such, we have taken best of breed technology, often from the VR space, and made it work for Nobot.
For example, this include:
  • Oculus Rift, for head tracking and camera
  • Leap Motion, for hand and arm control
Some items we have had or will have to custom build ourselves, for example a tethered treadmill for proportionate movement, but in the main we intend to rely on smarter minds than ours, where we can, for some of the really complex stuff.
In addition to the 'Professional' operators kit of Oculus Rift and Leap Motion, the Nobot can be controlled via an iPad, again, remotely.  


We will always make Nobot easily upgradeable where possible, for example you'll be able to buy a new $50 computer unit should one become available, rather than a new $500 Nobot.


Why we are Raising Funds on Indiegogo?

We are already well underway with Nobot development.  There are two key aspects to it:

  • The Nobot Hardware
  • The Nobot Software & Marketplace

Both of these are advancing well, driven by our experienced team and advisors who have done this sort of thing before.

We are raising funds on Indiegogo so that we can make the Nobot ecosystem better, faster.

We are confident of hitting our 1st November 2015 launch date for Nobot, irrespective of funding.  What we want to do however is maximise the number of partnerships and integrations we have completed with Nobot by that time.

For example, we intend to partner with household appliance and machinery manufacturers to make them Nobot ready.  A Nobot should be able to use your vacuum cleaner or drive your lawn mower.

We also intend to partner with retailers so that your Nobot can go and buy your latte or pick up your dry cleaning.


Accessories

In addition to the partnerships we will undertake with Nobot, we also plan to keep expanding the range of Nobot accessories.  

Currently, we have the right hand and arm unit, the NFC unit and the crawler tracks.  We already have an immediate roadmap of half a dozen additional accessories for Nobot, but will build on this.

With Indiegogo funding, these accessories will come to market more quickly and we will have more bandwidth to put in place accessory partnerships.


Nobot and the World

We believe that Nobot can and will change the world.  Think of the Matrix, but more prosaic and less evil!

For Owners

For owners, Nobot will improve their lives.  

  • For businesses, perhaps more dangerous tasks will no longer have to place a human in a position of harm.  
  • For individuals, perhaps they can send a Nobot out in the rain to get a coffee for them, or have a Nobot tidy the house!

There are a million ways a Nobot will be useful.  Cleaning, gardening, caring, serving, monitoring, etc. 

For Operators

For operators (owners can also operate the Nobot themselves), Nobot will facilitate better jobs, pay and prospects.  Nobot brings the benefits of globalisation to a huge number of people, reducing the need for those people to have to go to the benefits.

story:
My name is Joshua Hensley and I am the inventor of the Operator Survival Tool (O.S.T.). My patent pending invention is a survival multi-tool that was designed to help people when they need it most.

As a law enforcement officer, hunter and avid outdoorsman, I know how easy it is to find yourself unprepared in a difficult and dangerous situation. It was with this in mind that I created the O.S.T.

The O.S.T. is a tool designed to fulfill what I believe to be the three most basic needs in a survival situation.

The first and most important is the ability to keep your main tool of defense (in this case an Ar15), clean and operational. The O.S.T. has within it a stainless steel scraper tool that can aid in the disassembly and cleaning of the critical surfaces on the Ar15’s bolt, bolt carrier and firing pin. The scraper tool also has the ability to turn screwdriver bits for tightening scope mounts, open bottle tops and more.

The second most important and universal need for survival, is fire. The O.S.T. has a flint rod and steel within, allowing it to produce sparks and create fire despite any weather conditions. The O.S.T. housing becomes a handle for the flint rod.  

A third important aspect of the O.S.T. is a textured steel sharpening rod. The O.S.T. housing also becomes the handle for the sharpening rod. A sharp knife, scissors or hatchet can go a long way to improving one’s odds of survival. 

The reason the O.S.T. can be so effective, is its shape. It is an injected molded polymer designed to fit within the common battery compartments on Ar15 furniture (Pistol grips, Forward grips and Butt Stocks). You can now place the O.S.T. in your Ar15 and always have three critical aspects of survival with you at all times. 

The reason I am here accepting donations for my cause, is that I am trying to achieve the American dream, while at the same time, creating a superior product. I am trying to create a company from nothing more than an idea for a new product. I’m trying to make my product of quality materials and make them efficiently. The only way I know how to do that is to have custom molds made that allow me to make a quality product at a reasonable price point. I’m learning quickly that molds are very expensive.

All funds gathered here will go directly towards the custom molds needed and producing the first run of O.S.T. tools. Once the molds are made I feel that I can produce relatively small batches and sell them locally to grow my business slowly.

story:
EcoCrafting is a new start-up company specializing in environmentally friendly and future-oriented solutions in residential construction.

When our company is up and running, our vision is to build houses in developing countries. We intend on teaching individuals in these countries to build their own houses using environmentally-friendly, locally grown resources. This will create workplaces, housing, growth, and prosperity.

We are starting a pilot project with "Biocrete" a biological concrete that has yet to be used in Norway. In today’s construction industry, there's a growing need for energy efficient buildings. However, this often comes at the expense of price and indoor climate. Poor air quality indoors has detrimental effects on both our physical and cognitive health-- It's been proven by researchers at top universities such as Stanford, Harvard, and Yale!

Why pay hundreds of thousands of Euros (NOK) for a house that is toxic for you and your family's health? The current construction method uses materials that aren't environmentally friendly, or even "people" friendly, for that matter. This is something we NEED to change!

Our wall system brings competing u-values and a superior indoor heating/cooling system, ensuring that the temperature of your home is regulated at a fraction of the cost of a "regular" house. It's also fire resistant, pest resistant, mould resistant, earthquake resistant and has great acoustic insulation!

Our homes will compete with traditional construction prices while utilizing environmentally friendly materials. The finished construction will have a negative carbon footprint-- This is because Biocrete traps and consumes CO2 in the atmosphere. In fact, the CO2 helps the Biocrete become stronger and solidified, making your new home as environmentally resistant as it is friendly!

These modern homes will be elegantly designed with smart, user-friendly technology--A true home of the future! It will produce clean energy that the owner can sell to their neighbors, or better yet, to the community. Imagine making a profit while saving the planet!

Please support our project and help us steer the construction industry into a more sustainable, healthy and environmentally friendly direction. Change starts small, but we hope that someday, we'll be able to provide EcoCrafted homes to millions of people.

story:
I am a mom of two young girls who prefer my home-cooked meals over school lunches and boring sandwiches. After trying several thermoses on the market, I couldn't find anything that stayed hot long enough, and would allow me to send a side dish along with a main dish in the same container. I found myself daydreaming of making a product that would do just that, but never imagined it would be possible. I wouldn't know where to begin...  Suddenly I remembered that I have a friend who is a product designer. After seeking her advice, I decided to turn my daydream into a reality. After all, many people have ideas, very few act on them. I wanted to be one that ACTS on it. For months, after full days of work, and sending the kids off to bed  I poured myself into research and development. I learned the process one step at a time. I took a crash course in business and marketing. I kept everything a secret from friends and family until the long awaited sample products were delivered to my door (just in case). I had done it!  It was beautiful! And most importantly it worked!! Of course I am only half way to realizing my dream of being an entrepreneur, and product developer. With the help of backers I will be able to pay for molds, marketing and branding, begin production, and order enough quantity to launch the product in two countries just in time for back to school (mid August 2017).  Our family takes a trip to India twice a year, and have decided that for every unit of product sold, we will feed a family in need. If you are compelled to contribute at this time, I graciously thank you. Also, please take the time to share this with as many people as you can.

Sincerely,

Tina McGonagill

#bigfatlunch

story:
Hello everyone! 

QUESTIONS?

  1. Have you ever run out of toilet paper in your bathroom at the most inconvenient moment? 
  2. Have you ever yelled out to your partner or kids to bring you a new roll because you ran out?
  3.  Are your extra rolls sometimes stored inside the plastic bag on the floor, or in a little basket or canister? 
  4. Are you also tired of using or reloading the same inefficient, single, toilet roll dispensers still fitted in your home bathrooms like the ones shown below?


Welcome to PACK N' ROLL™ - The revolutionary, efficient, and  colorful all-in-one compact home toilet roll dispenser/storage/decor.


My name is Dayo Akinbinu. I love creative and innovative ideas. I'm very passionate and fascinated with creating new things and using innovation to improve our lives by making it easy and comfortable for people. My new revolutionary and innovative all-in-one PACK N' ROLL™ home toilet roll dispenser/storage/decor, will make every home more functional and efficient.




                                  OLD IS OUT


                                   NEW IS IN




PACK N' ROLL™  toilet roll dispenser - The innovative and revolutionary 3-pack, 4-pack, and 6-pack home/office toilet roll dispenser/storage/decor. Enjoy three [3] basic designs in six [6] color choices. They're easy to load and easy to dispense!


                                          COLORS

Although we've shown many different colors of PACK N' ROLL™, these are the six [6] main colors: White, Pink, Beige, Black, Purple, and Red. These four other colors are optional: Teal, Clear,  Green,and Brown. 




  

                                   STRETCH  GOAL: $50,000


                            The 3-packs wall mount PACK N' ROLL™                                                                 dispensers/storage/decor


The pictures of the 3-pack wall-mount PACK N' ROLL™ are the actual prototype built to show the uniqueness, practical design, and application of our new home dispenser/storage/decor. There will be six colors to chose from, plus three [3] additional luxury models. Some of the colors may vary. The 3-pack may be more suitable for children's bathrooms.


     

  The 4-pack Standing or mounting PACK N' ROLL™                       dispensers/storage/decor 

   

The pictures of the 4-pack floor-standing PACK N' ROLL™ are the actual prototype built to show the uniqueness, practical design, applications of our new home dispenser/storage/decor. There will be six colors to chose from,  plus three [3] additional luxury models. Some of the colors may vary.    

 


                                    The 6-packs Standing PACK N' ROLL™                                                                                    dispensers/storage/decor

The pictures of the 6-pack floor-standing PACK N' ROLL™ are the actual prototype built to show the uniqueness, practical design, applications of our new home dispenser/storage/decor. There will be six colors to chose from,  plus three [3] additional luxury models. Some of the colors may vary.    



                                   PACK N' ROLL™ AS A DECOR

PACK N' ROLL™ was designed not as another ordinary bathroom fixture or mere bathroom toilet roll holder, but was designed also as a decorating stand in full colors to brighten your bathrooms and to hold bathroom essentials as seen in the picture below.

                          


                        The 3-pack PACK N' ROLL™ in six [6] color choices

                                         

                    
                    The 4-pack PACK N' ROLL™ in six [6] color choices                                          


                               PRICE REVIEW OF OLD PLAIN DISPENSERS

               

              HOW TO MOUNT YOUR PACK N' ROLL™ ON THE WALL

  •  Locate a stud inside the wall near your toilet seat with convenient arm reach to mount your unit.
  •  Line up your Pack N' Roll dispenser unit perfectly straight and balanced, and make sure the four (4) holes align with the center of the wall stud.
  • Mark the four (4) holes on your wall for the screws.
  • Screw in the top hole screw first, and then screw in the bottom hole screw next, and make sure the dispenser is straight and centered before tightening.
  • Screw in the two (2) middle screws and make sure your unit is tight and steady on the wall before loading your rolls.                             

                                                 MANUFACTURING
PACK N' ROLL™ will be manufacture by China Plastic Synergy Group, a professional company specialized in making all kinds of plastic injection molding products. All drawings and manufacturing specifications, and materials related to PACK N' ROLL™ are already in place. We know we are in a good place and very confident to deliver a good and durable PACK N' ROLL™ to your bathrooms.
story_txt:
Hello everyone! QUESTIONS?
Have you ever run out of toilet paper in your bathroom at the most inconvenient moment? 
Have you ever yelled out to your partner or kids to bring you a new roll because you ran out?
 Are your extra rolls sometimes stored inside the plastic bag on the floor, or in a little basket or canister? 
Are you also tired of using or reloading the same inefficient, single, toilet roll dispensers still fitted in your home bathrooms like the ones shown below?

Welcome to PACK N' ROLL™ - The revolutionary, efficient, and  colorful all-in-one compact home toilet roll dispenser/storage/decor.

My name is Dayo Akinbinu. I love
creative and innovative ideas. I'm very passionate and fascinated with creating
new things and using innovation to improve our lives by making it easy and
comfortable for people. My new
revolutionary and innovative all-in-one PACK N' ROLL™ home toilet
roll dispenser/storage/decor, will make every home more functional and
efficient.


                                  OLD IS OUT                                   NEW IS IN



PACK N' ROLL™  toilet roll dispenser - The innovative and revolutionary 3-pack, 4-pack, and 6-pack home/office toilet roll dispenser/storage/decor. Enjoy three [3] basic designs in six [6] color choices. They're easy to load and easy to dispense!
                                          COLORS

Although we've shown many different colors of PACK N' ROLL™, these are the six [6] main colors: White, Pink, Beige, Black, Purple, and Red. These four other colors are optional: Teal, Clear,  Green,and Brown. 




                                     STRETCH  GOAL: $50,000




                            The 3-packs wall mount PACK N' ROLL™                                                                 dispensers/storage/decor



The pictures of the 3-pack wall-mount PACK N' ROLL™ are the actual
prototype built to show the uniqueness, practical design, and application
of our new home dispenser/storage/decor. There will be six colors to chose from, plus
three [3] additional luxury models. Some of the colors may vary. The 3-pack may
be more suitable for children's bathrooms.
       The 4-pack Standing or mounting PACK N' ROLL™                       dispensers/storage/decor    The pictures of the 4-pack floor-standing PACK N' ROLL™
are the actual prototype built to show the uniqueness, practical
design, applications of our new home dispenser/storage/decor. There will be six
colors to chose from,  plus three [3] additional luxury models. Some
of the colors may vary.    
 


                                    The 6-packs Standing PACK N' ROLL™                                                                                    dispensers/storage/decor


The pictures of the 6-pack floor-standing PACK N' ROLL™
are the actual prototype built to show the uniqueness, practical
design, applications of our new home dispenser/storage/decor. There will be six
colors to chose from,  plus three [3] additional luxury models. Some
of the colors may vary.    




                                   PACK N' ROLL™ AS A DECOR
PACK N' ROLL™ was designed not as another ordinary bathroom fixture or mere bathroom toilet roll holder, but was designed also as a decorating stand in full colors to brighten your bathrooms and to hold bathroom essentials as seen in the picture below.



                          


                        The 3-pack PACK N' ROLL™ in six [6] color choices



                                         
                    
                    The 4-pack PACK N' ROLL™ in six [6] color choices                                          









                               PRICE REVIEW OF OLD PLAIN DISPENSERS



               

              HOW TO MOUNT YOUR PACK N' ROLL™ ON THE WALL


 Locate a stud inside the wall near your toilet seat with convenient arm reach to mount your unit.


 Line up your Pack N' Roll dispenser unit perfectly straight and balanced, and make sure the four (4) holes align with the center of the wall stud.

Mark the four (4) holes on your wall for the screws.

Screw in the top hole screw first, and then screw in the bottom hole screw next, and make sure the dispenser is straight and centered before tightening.


Screw in the two (2) middle screws and make sure your unit is tight and steady on the wall before loading your rolls.

PACK N' ROLL™ will be manufacture by China Plastic Synergy Group, a professional company specialized in making all kinds of plastic injection molding products. All drawings and manufacturing specifications, and materials related to PACK N' ROLL™ are already in place. We know we are in a good place and very confident to deliver a good and durable PACK N' ROLL™ to your bathrooms.
